name: SgudaSmartLock
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Connecting your SGUDA Lock to Amazon Alexa makes access control even quicker and safer.

SGUDA provides the following practical features via Alexa voice control
-You can lock your door,
-Unlock your door with a voice pin from Alexa
-And know the status of your SGUDA lock

Please follow the instructions in your SGUDA app to set up each SGUDA Lock with Alexa.

To get started,
-Search for "Sguda Smart Lock" in the smart home section of the Alexa app, then select the "Enable to use" button
-Link your SGUDA Lock account to allow the skill permission to access your locks.
-You will require to set a pin code at the end of the account linking if you want to enable unlocking via Alexa.
-Once your accounts are linked you can select the "Discover device” button. Alexa will scan your lock automatically.


Now you can lock, unlock or check the SGUDA lock status with Alexa.
Just give Alexa voice commands like the following examples:

To control the SGUDA smart locks connected to your Amazon Alexa, you can ask Alexa is the <lock name> lock/unlocked?
- “Alexa, is the front door locked/unlocked?”.

You can ask Alexa to lock the <lock name> .
-“Alexa, lock the front door”.

Or you can ask Alexa to unlock the <lock name>. The option to unlock will require a voice pin whenever you attempt to unlock your lock by voice.
-“Alexa, unlock the front door”.
- Then, say the code.
Your front door should be unlocked.
